div1.head: Letter from Emilie Lawrence Reed to the Adjutant General, December 27, 1902
div1.p:
Requests that certain letters
of a laudatory character with re-
ference to the official and scientific
work of her late husband, Major Walter
Reed, Surg. USA on file in War Dept,
be given to her [unclear]
[unclear] to [unclear] that they be turn-
ed over to Maj. J. R. Kean, Surg. USA.
in the office of the Surgeon Gen'l USA.

Jany. 5/03, the [unclear] papers
were handed to Major J. R. Kean
Surgeon, General's Office, by M Grabar
428701 A.G.O. & its addl's “a” to “k”
with all enclosures thereto, except
addl “E”, in which case only

Received
A. G. O.
M. & R. D.
DEC 30 1902

Enclosure 1 of that paper
was given.

Norfolk, Virginia, December 27, 1902.
To the
Adjutant General of the Army,
Washington, D. C.,

Among the papers on file in the War Department with reference to
the official record of my late husband, Major Walter Reed, Surgeon, U. S.
Army, there are, I believe, some letters of a laudatory character with
reference to his official and scientific work. I presume these letters
are no longer needed in the War Department, and as it will be a pleasure
to me to have them I request that they be given to me.

It is requested that they be turned over to Major J. R. Kean,
Surgeon, U. S. Army, in the office of the Surgeon General of the Army.

Dec. 27, 1902, Mrs. Reed, widow
of Major Walter Reed, Medical Dept.,
requests the return to her of letters
of a laudatory character with refer-
ence to the official and scientific
work of her late husband.

The papers are herewith and
appear to be recommendations for
Major Reed's appointment as Surgeon
General. Some are from commanding
officers and others from the faculties
of Harvard & Columbian Universities,
etc. No action has been taken on
any of them, except letters to the
writers acknowledging receipt.

Mrs. Reed asks that the papers
be sent to Major Kean, Surgeon, on
duty in the Surgeon General's Office.

Make a note of
these and send
to Maj. Kean,
requesting directing
that they be
referenced when
he has finished
with them
